website_summaries.verdict: Reliable Hydrofarm brand delivers a quality plant heating mat that is built to last.
pros: Thick, durable mat stays flat and is available in multiple sizes
Germinates seeds in roughly half of the normal time
Heat is evenly distributed throughout mat and stays at a consistent temperature
cons: Mat sits at a slightly higher price point

customer_reviews.title: Two Happy Growers
customer_reviews.text: We have already gotten half our money back on the purchase of three of these lights in one months electric bill. Went from $324 to $156. The plants love em and growing better than with the sodium or halite lights (much cheaper too). Love the 120 day guarantee (one growth cycle) for returning. So far, we have no complaints and have plans to purchase three more if still available when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Christeen Landino

customer_reviews.title: Kills your seedlings. Do Not Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: This heat mat killed an entire 200 cell starter tray of Impatiens in just two days. It got so hot that you could not even touch the mat. Other reviewers have had this same problem so obviously Hydrofarm has not corrected the issue. Save yourself the cost and frustration and shop elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Brewing Kombucha
customer_reviews.text: I love this heat mat. I use it for 7 day periods with it on 24/7 (no thermostat) placed underneath the gallon glass jar in which the kombucha I brew resides. It brews much faster in higher temperatures, and this heat mat provides 10 degree increase without ever getting dangerously hot.
customer_reviews.author: cryptix

customer_reviews.title: Too hot!
customer_reviews.text: Set this up to start seeds in cell packs (which I've been doing for 30 + years). Waaaaay too hot! I set a small thermometer on TOP of one of the cell packs, the temp was around 100 degrees F!!!! I tried putting the cell packs on an upside down seed tray, to put a little distance between the cell packs and the heat pad, it was still over 90 degrees. Then I tried putting the seed trays on and inch of cardboard layers. That seemed to keep the cell packs around 80 degrees. To keep from frying my seeds and seedlings, I had to disconnect the mat.
customer_reviews.author: Gomershad

customer_reviews.title: This light is amazing! Little to no heat
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and put it to use immediately. This light is amazing! Little to no heat, very bright and my plants are loving it. I was using CFL before and it would take nearly 3 weeks for them to Get where they are now. This really speeds up the process and will probably shave at least 2 to 3 weeks off the growing cycle
customer_reviews.author: Dean J. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Something that does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Got these after trying another brand (Vivosun) which was returned. These come flat, and are of better construction. Using a time, a temp control, and many small plantings from old seeds, I have had success in starting a COVID garden during the Easter season (March-May), with most of my plants sprouting and growing nicely. I am very happy with these, and how they work. Will continue to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Heldenbaer1

customer_reviews.title: Reliably Holds Needed Temperature
customer_reviews.text: I'm finding this heat mat to reliably hold the temperature needed to get my flower seedlings off to a good start. It seems to work very well in conjunction with the Jump Start MTPRTC Digital Controller Thermostat I ordered to go with it. The mat is big enough to nicely accommodate my two 10X20-inch flats and I am getting close to an 80% seed sprouting success. I can take very little credit for that so I guess I'd say my Hydro Farm Jump Start heat mat, light stand, and thermostat were a good choice. I think it's wise to purchase same brand items when they are going to be working together. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene MacCadie.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap n horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Half of the entire light blew out after 2 short weeks. Emailed manufacturer, they asked for pics so I sent them, and then they gave me the run around which will leave my plants with no light. Ordered a viparspectra came within 2 days plants loving it. Don’t buy!!!! I will update my review after I see how recordcent handles the broke light
customer_reviews.author: Tommy tee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these and insulated the bottom. None of them worked well. Tiny bit of heat at insertion area but rest of the surface area of the mat was cold. Will return. Bummer
customer_reviews.author: california woman

customer_reviews.title: Great for bread baking!
customer_reviews.text: I use this mat for a slightly unusual purpose. For making Danish rye bread, and the the sourdough starter that's needed for the bread. I purchased mine in 2015 and use it every month when I bake. It is just the right temp to get my sourdough starter bubbling and active, and helps the rye bread dough to rise before baking. I have not used it to start seeds, but it works great for the purpose I purchased it for!
customer_reviews.author: sunnyv

customer_reviews.title: The warms makes a difference for encouraging seeds to grow.
customer_reviews.text: I've used 2 of these pads off and on for several years. The warmth improves my early spring sprout growth. I know because the soil trays with the heating pads always work better that the trays just sitting on my counter without the pads. Part of the reason may be that I tend to keep the house temperature low.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Homebrewing is an alternative use for this
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this to use with a temperature controller for home brewing. Wrapping this around my fermenter, inserting a temperature probe into the fermenter, and connecting this to the temperature controller, I was able to keep a 5-gallon batch of beer in a plastic fermenter at the ideal fermentation temperature in my basement. If your environment was particularly cold (say 60 degrees F or less) this might not have enough wattage to keep your beer warm but it worked fine in a 63-65 degree basement to keep my beer in the 68-70 degree range necessary for the brew I made.
customer_reviews.author: M. Salsbury

customer_reviews.title: Excellent when used to control fermentation temps for home brewing
customer_reviews.text: Excellent when used to control fermentation temps for home brewing. Can be used to heat 2 carboys at once by shaping the mat in an "S" shape and placing the carboys in the nooks of the "S". Then wrap some insulation around the whole setup (I use a camping foam sleep mat - Thermarest Z-Rest to be exact). Using this method I can raise the temperature by 15 degrees. If I wrap the heat mat around just 1 carboy (and insulate again the the z-rest), I can raise the temperature 25 degrees. Paired with a thermostat and you have an excellent fermentation chamber.
customer_reviews.author: The_Lost_Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this crap!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to start her seeds in the spring of 2014. She plugged it in this week to start seeds again. It no longer heats. So it lasted 4 years, only being used for a month or 2 each year! Surely there are better choices. Don't waste your money on this crap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR KOMBUCHA MAKING TOO
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Most people probably use this for seedlings -- I have no need for that anymore. But it's the PERFECT temp for fermenting my Kombucha that I make at home in Glass jars. It's about 10 degrees above room temp -- and the yeasties love that. The results is Kombucha that ferments fully within 6 - 7 days without being bitter from overfermentation & production of too much acid. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: wefishallday

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for starting peppers and other plants that benefit from ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 48" version two years ago with Hydrofarm thermostat. I use it only for a month at a time to start seedlings. Barely gets warm and wont keep the soil above 68 deg F now! Not useful for starting peppers and other plants that benefit from warm soil. Update 1: mat has completely failed. I've basically used it twice since I bought it, stored flat. Made for some very expensive tomato plants. Junk. Update 2: Their customer service wrote back refusing to replace the mat since it was >1 yr old. Interestingly, she tacitly admitted that the version I have was unreliable has been improved and the new model now has a low return rate.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kafer

customer_reviews.title: Money very well spent
customer_reviews.text: Having always started my garden seeds indoors to get a jump on our short growing season (high altitude, mountains), I decided to try this mat to see if it helped accelerate the growth. Boy was I surprised at how well it works! It took only a couple days before I saw signs of growth vs. several days like in the past. I cannot say enough good things about this mat - it is fabulous if you are wanting to start seedlings indoors in cold climates.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi's Opinion

customer_reviews.title: No power cable or hanging kit...
customer_reviews.text: Just received the 1000w light. Problem is, it didn't come with the hanging kit or even a power cable. Uh... Is this correct??! Luckily I had a kit and cable from my last light, but I'm pretty sure this should come with it. Am I wrong? Update: just to be clear, the light itself is great. Seems super bright and I can definitely tell the difference between my 300w and this. Just seems strange to come with no power cord or hanging kit. If this is a mistake please let me know. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan R.

customer_reviews.title: Bright
customer_reviews.text: Very bright. I'm not a pot grower, I own a nursery and grow other plants. I would have rather found something less red in the light, but that's what makes pot flower and that's who is buying the most lights. Anyway, they are bright and they will do the job. Just sort of weird color light. Good value and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for indoor germination...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first year using a heat mat and my germination rates were off the charts. IMO this is a must have if you start your seeds inside in the winter months. Just be sure to buy the accompanying thermostat as this has no means to self regulate the temperature and will remain on as long as it's plugged in resulting in soil temps that are too high. Also, as others may have mentioned, it's very important to use this mat on top of a piece of styrofoam insulation board...I actually was not able to maintain soil temps until I put this mat on top of a piece of insulation...
customer_reviews.author: Marino M.

customer_reviews.title: They're all still growing
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My plants love the light. I have a 1500w cob led light next to it on home grown vegetables. They do not take away from the 1000w light I purchased from this seller. The plants directly under this light which is directly next to the 1500w do not bend to the 1500w. Which was a par concern of mine. I want to awash my plants in light & now I have 2500w's of light shining on my garden. I'm having nutrient issues but not light issues.
customer_reviews.author: Asw

customer_reviews.title: Great value, don’t forget to feed plants accordingly!
customer_reviews.text: Great value - runs cooler than a 300w growlight I have in another tent. 10/10 would recommend. I’m currently running this at 18/6 (on/off) and my plants are doing well. Note for newbies: don’t forget to make sure you provide enough P nutrients (NPK) - key nutrient needed in converting all that light into usanble energy for the plant. Would also recommend Doctor earth 4-4-4 for growing - 2tbps per gallon would have you plants feeling top not and let you veg to a healthy level within 4-5 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!  Works perfect for bottom warming seed germination trays.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for bottom warming a single tray for seed germination. We bought multiple ones and were very happy with them. They self regulate temperature so you won’t need an additional thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Grow light
customer_reviews.text: I have just started to use the light so I'm not sure how the plant is going to grow using this light. The light is bright and well made and the switch on top is a plus, since my other grow lights I own don't have one. The two fans on top work well in keeping the light cool to the touch. I will have to come back and let you know how the plant did through the veg and flowing stages. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zonnies

customer_reviews.title: Great - just don’t forget to get a controller
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had our first mat for over a year and I’m getting ready to order another. Ignore the reviews that said it killed their plants because it got too hot - that’s people who didn’t order the very necessary thermostat/controller. If you don’t have it hooked up to a controller it will run at max capacity. Don’t make that mistake...buy the controller too.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Seems quality, works well
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my Kombucha. The perfect amount of heat. It's not adjustable heat but doesn't need to be and is nice and long to put the large round 1 1/2 gallon Kombucha jar on as well as my other gallon jar for the finished product and still has extra room. Of course time will tell about how long it lasts. Can't say as it's only been about 2 weeks using this.
customer_reviews.author: CCC

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I don't need a big heat mat so this one was the right size. All I needed was a thermostat and I was done. My warm weather seedlings came up within a 10 day period. The probe cable was long enough so that I didn't need to keep the germination kit close to an outlet. This is the first time I used a heat mat and I am sold.
customer_reviews.author: kelika14

customer_reviews.title: Came defective but replaced quickly
customer_reviews.text: Came defective, only half of the LEDs were working, I immediately submitted a replacement request and received a new one on Tuesday. In the meantime the half of the LEDs that weren't working started to work. LoL I used them to sidelight my refugium and my chaeto has visibly grown. The replacement light worked just fine and I will keep it and tomorrow I am returning the first one. The light is extremely bright and has excellent cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D.

customer_reviews.title: Gets way too hot...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these 48" heat mats to start vegetable seedlings. I noticed only the seeds located along the perimeter of the mat have sprouted... And that the center of the mats seemed pretty hot. I grabbed an infrared thermometer to measure temp under my seedlings... 120-130 degrees. My house is at 65 degrees. These heat mats are way too hot... Half of my seeds have been cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: Mine is 5-8 years old and still working
customer_reviews.text: This has no "temperature control". It raises the temp based on the starting room temp. It does not seem to over heat which is a bad thing. I grow 20+ tomato seedlings with one mat and they turn out great.
customer_reviews.author: TheBob

customer_reviews.title: Good heat mats
customer_reviews.text: This is my first season with them. I bought two four-foot wide ones to start with. They fit nicely on four-foot wide shelves as long as the legs on the shelving don't compromise the shelves themselves (i.e., the legs attach on the outside of the shelves and don't cut out the corners of the shelves). They have worked flawlessly so far and I got good germination rates. I don't have multi-year experience with them yet, so I don't know how long they will last. I hope for many years.
customer_reviews.author: B. Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Big Healthy Seedlings
customer_reviews.text: This seedling heating mat works like a charm. My seedlings have never been bigger or stronger. It keeps the soil at just the right temperature without overheating. The mat fits perfectly under the seedling tray. When used with the plastic greenhouse dome over the seedling tray the soil was slightly warm to the touch and without the dome the top 1/3 of the soil is cooler but the bottom of the soil is warm. I have found that the my cold weather crops do not like the extra heat so I would not recommend this heating mat for brassicas (cabbage, cauliflower, broccoli, Brussels sprouts.)
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this same one about 3 years, worked well. When it died I bought another one, and it stopped working after 2 Months. I contacted the manufacturer directly and have not received any response. I put 2 stars because the 1st purchase lasted a while.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: They do the job well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one last year. It made a big difference in the time it took seeds started indoors to germinate and it is performing consistently again this year, so I just bought three more because the seeds I started a month ago were germinating on the one mat I had, but not on the others. Once the vegetable seedlings are ready to go outside in the late spring, I'll use the mats to grow microgreens inside. Since my plant stand is kept in an unheated room, I especially depend on the warmth of the mats during winter. So far, so good. Hope they will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Romeo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but it's only half of what you need
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for speeding up your gardening. You can get jump start on the season, and have greater harvests, by starting your seeds indoors ahead of time. You'll save money in the long run by not buying plants AND you can grow the specific varieties you want and not have to choose only what your nursery is offering. But this is only half of equation. For best results I highly recommend using a thermostat/temp-troller in conjunction to this heating mat. Unchecked, it is easy for seedlings to be dried out and/or cooked. Maintaining a good temperature will make for happy and vigorous seedlings, which ultimately makes for a strong and happy plants.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Juriga

customer_reviews.title: Mistakes happen with even the best products but not even attempting to make good on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with high hopes. It worked at first but after two weeks it would not get as warm and it is heating uneven. I emailed their customer service and after a week and a half they have not responded to my email. Mistakes happen with even the best products but not even attempting to make good on them is not acceptable. I would look else where.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: Good Mat - Large Area
customer_reviews.text: It lasted all winter. I've used a smaller mat for two years now. I use a thermostat with it to shut it off above a certain temperature. It legitimately holds 4 rectangular seed trays. I was using smaller trays this year with humidity domes to reduce the amount of watering I had to do. But when I water I spray the whole system down, sometimes even the thermostat gets a rinse. I used half the mat to heat seeds and the other half to keep the seedlings warm while I started another batch of seeds. The only problem with a mat this large is if you want to run two different temperatures you are talking about a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Product came not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Received the product inside of a small plain box that was not the original packaging. It was all rolled up and completely unusable in that state. Had been rolled up in the box it could not sit flat and kept pushing my seed box around. The mat eventually pushed the box off and roll itself up while powered on... Not happy with this product. Should have went with something of higher quality, or at least left in the original packaging. After further inspection, I'm not even sure the product is working. It does not feel as if it is generating any heat at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: This will grow your seeds
customer_reviews.text: I've had several seedling (smaller) heat mats before, and decided to purchase a large one for all the tomatoes I'm planning to grow. This mat is huge, and easily fit 4 of my tomato seed trays. My seeds sprouted immediately, around day 3, and I know this was attributed to the heat mat. Roll and store away safely when not in use. I plan on using this mat every year, as I no longer purchase plants, but grow them from seed. Really great purchase, and good price. I do see some mats cheaper online, but I'm of the camp that thinks cheaper price=cheaper product, and anything plugged in should not be really cheap quality.
customer_reviews.author: SummerTimeSadness

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Super bright and my plants love it! The foliage are flourishing. So far, so good with 2 weeks of use. I will be purchasing another one in the very near future. It took me quite a while to choose with all of the options and all. But, I'm confident that I couldn't have made a better choice. This was very smart buy for me. My plants will be happy year round.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had ordered more than one...
customer_reviews.text: Nice thin heat mat for seed starting. I ordered a digital thermostat to keep the temperature consistent. I would suggest placing a towel, or something underneath it to help insulate it from the surface you set it on. That seemed to help with keeping the temperature more consistent until my thermostat arrived.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome seed starter
customer_reviews.text: Seeds germinate quickly, bought more than one pad, one gets very hot, one doesn't. I returned one and it's replacement got just as hot as the one I returned. Not quite sure which temperature it's supposed to be, but I have a feeling that it's getting way hotter than it's supposed to. The company said it supposed to be within 20° above ambient, or room, temperature. I tried to test its temperature with a thermometer, but once it reached 108°, my thermometer would not go any higher, my guess is that thing went to about 120. But, no harm done. Seeds always germinate at least a week and a half quicker then without the pad
customer_reviews.author: BaldCats

customer_reviews.title: Raises temperature slightly, faster germination by 1-2 days
customer_reviews.text: This seedling mat claims to raise the temperature- it's warm to the touch, but isn't significantly warmer. You really have to put insulation underneath the seed mat because the heat will seep into the floor or counter faster than your seedlings. I used a stack of 4 fabric place mats, and that seemed to help. 1 layer of cardboard did not. I guess slight warming is better than frying your seedlings! I did not actually measure the temperature with a thermometer. Fun fact: You can also use this to make bread or pizza dough rise faster.
customer_reviews.author: mg4643

customer_reviews.title: Keeps those seeds warm so they all germinate
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for germinating seeds that need warmer temps.Of course I'm also using a thermostat to control the temp, but if I need 72F temps, I'm getting 72F tems and not something that wanders all over the place. I've had very good germination as a result, getting a jump on the spring growing season. Don't forget to read your seed packet so you don't use this on cool-germination crops, like lettuces!
customer_reviews.author: R. White

customer_reviews.title: Very useful. Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to help germinate some cucumbers I started indoors in a small greenhouse tent. At night when the grow lights are unplugged the inside get fairly chilly like the rest of the house, but with this heat mat I can leave it on all night and not have to worry about the seedlings. I would say it keeps the inside temperatures a good 10 degrees warmer than without it. I found the cord to be a little short but it's really no big deal. Before purchasing I compared this with the ones for sale on Gardener's Supply and this seemed to be much better value for the size.
customer_reviews.author: SarahR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for warming seedling tray.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a standard seedling tray. Doesn't need a rheostat if it is used in cool weather, which is really the only time it is needed. It goes up to 20 degrees warmer than ambient when it is not too cool but when it is cool, say under 60, it only warms about 10 degrees above ambient. I've been starting seeds all winter long with this and have had excellent results. No problem in moist areas or even if it gets wet just don;t wet the plug or the socket. Good outdoors (with same precaution for electrical connection) or indoors. Super handy for any gardener who starts seedlings all year round.
customer_reviews.author: TinyForest

customer_reviews.title: Great for beer
customer_reviews.text: I use it, combined with a temperature controller, to keep my Picobrew C keg at the proper fermenting temperature. It’s an inch and a half short of going fully around the keg but still does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: mix579

customer_reviews.title: Cold hands no more!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my gardener wife who has perpetually cold hands and works in an office. She keeps it under her keyboard for most of the year and reluctantly loans it to her seedlings in the spring. t produces a nice, comfortable warmth that her office-mates are all envious of. Much less energy than running a space heater, and it stays cool enough to be safe on an office desk. Also less expensive and more versatile than a heated keyboard, and USB doesn't supply enough power to heat anything so a functional heated keyboard will still take up a power outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Shop Hydrofarms
customer_reviews.text: I luv the consistent quality I receive with Hydrofarms products. Are there less expensive products out there? Ofcourse.In the end you get what you pay for.I take my gardensing serious here in the midwest and come March when it's time critical to start my garden indoors I need proven performance to get my seedlings out of the soil and growing. I have confidently bought heatmats and growlights from Hydrofarms and the results speak for themselves.Great products at a respectable price.
customer_reviews.author: drew  modic

customer_reviews.title: Gets good and hot
customer_reviews.text: I've always used heat mats to speed the germination of my seeds (especially for tomatoes and peppers, which like a warmer soil). My old heat mats were not putting out enough heat anymore, so I bought these to replace them. They're working great! Putting out plenty of heat to warm the soil. I'm using them in my unheated greenhouse, and the air temp inside the seed flat with a plastic cover is consistently 20 or more degrees higher than the air in the greenhouse itself. I put them on a piece of insulated foam board to stop the loss of the heat, and that seems to really help.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh A

customer_reviews.title: Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: Not anywhere close to my other 1000 watt LED lights. No way at all. More white light in this one too. Works for what I needed, just not exactly as described in terms of strength of light.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: I have the seedlings in a porcelain tub which stays very cool. When I put the mat directly on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This heated mat worked wonders for my tomato seedlings. I have the seedlings in a porcelain tub which stays very cool. When I put the mat directly on the tub it didn't seem to heat well, so I placed the box it came it underneath it to provide some insulation from the cold surface of the tub. The mat now heats well. I'm sure there are better insulating materials to use. I've had it on for approximately three weeks and the temperature has seemed to stay consistant.
customer_reviews.author: fotohiker

customer_reviews.title: Noticably improves germination rates
customer_reviews.text: The item appears to be well constructed. It has significantly improved my germination speed and growth rate of tomato and eggplant seeds. It's also pretty flexible so I'm able to bend it up to cover the edges of the trays which also helps warm them. I don't see a need for a separate thermostat for this. It is pretty gentle warming and unlikely to bake what's in your trays.
customer_reviews.author: D. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with germination.
customer_reviews.text: Planted stuff on Friday and with grow lights I had germination by Sunday. It was a little hard to keep down and it wants to stay rolled. Also it was square and my seed pallets are rectangular so I can only use one per pallet. I will try to put two on there but it might not work as well. Will update after my second half of experiment.
customer_reviews.author: dawindancr

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand for years to start seeds, it is thick and sturdy. I needed another one and did not hesitate to pay extra for the durability, it is an investment.
customer_reviews.author: JILL STURGIS

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This heat mat has been great! We used it under flats of seedlings and had great germination and growth, even in our cold house in February/March. I wish the temperature was adjustable, but we would just crack open the lid of the seedling trays if it seemed like the plants were getting too warm. This is a great improvement over the heating pad/towel we used to warm our seedlings in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I use it every year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in November 2012 because I was growing some fragile orchid seedlings that required additional bottom heat. My room temperature at that time was only 65F, so the heat was necessary to get the orchids to grow optimally through the winter. The heat pad worked great and produced enough heat to keep the plants warm, but not so hot as to burn them. I decided to write this review now because, well, it is 2015 and my heat pad is still warming up my plants as I type right now!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for anyone who wants to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for anyone who wants to start plants from seed. I wired a dimmer switch into an extension cord to control the temp at about 75F. Without the dimmer they (I have 2) were going up to 85F, which is too hot. I lay a cheap thermometer on the pad to check the temp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty decent, as long as you put something under ...
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty decent, as long as you put something under it to insulate as other reviewers suggested. One thing I did notice is that I put plants on the mat and other plants off the mat...the ones on the mat had much more success than unwarmed plants right next to the warmed ones. I would highly recommend a plant light to go with this if you are leaving your plants indoors without much sunlight. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Great item for seed starting
customer_reviews.text: For about 6 years I've tried starting my vegetable plants from seed and every year I've failed. This year I bought a grow light from a home improvement store online. I set it up in the basement and after about a month about half of the seeds germinated. I decided to try a heat mat. It arrived in 2 days with Amazon Prime. After using the mat and replanting the seeds that didn't grow they all came up. The plants really started growing great. By the time I was ready to transplant outside the tomato plants were about 15 inches tall. I bought another mat so I can start more seeds next year.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I use these to heat some amphibian enclosures ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use these to heat some amphibian enclosures because the branded ones for reptile use are both too hot and pretty shoddy. These are nice and thin so they fit right under my tanks. They work even better if they sit on top of some rigid insulation foam. These used with insulation consistently raise my tank temps 10 or 12 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: Prepping for Spring
customer_reviews.text: Sigh...ex-hubby got the heating mats in the divorce so had to get replacements. Have used this brand every spring for years and never had a problem with them. Got the bigger 20x20" this time to conserve room on the seedling table. Has the same germination chart for easy reference. Heats 10-20 degrees above ambient room temp. Seems well made, so I'm sure I'll continue to get great use out of it. I gave it 4 stars simply because they continue to be expensive. Although I guess that's better than burn-your-house-down cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Adobe Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Works as stated - my seeds are sprouting!
customer_reviews.text: It's a little stiff to roll out the first time, so do this the day before you plan to use. Plug it in and the heat generated will help to flatten. Good, light heat as promised! Plenty big for the bottom shelf of my homemade 2-shelf seed starter. I used my old smaller Hydrofarm mat for the top shelf - since heat rises, any pots not in direct contact on the smaller mat got the benefit of the rising heat from the lower large mat. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: T. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Me
customer_reviews.text: This took my indoor seed-starting from 100% kill rate to more like 80%. Not sure what I do wrong, but I think a grow lamp is next year's splurge. That's my problem though, not the matt's. The quality is great. It holds two large Jiffy flats of starting pellets. I have had it plugged in for several months almost constantly, and it's still working strong. It doesn't pull much electric, which is nice too. Just put a couple towels or something to insulate it if you need to raise the temperature a little more. Works great, and if I ever figure out how NOT to kill things, I'll get a second one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Koehn

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I start my seeds in a cool temperature walk in basement (normal temp in there is around 55-60 in winter/early spring) and this mat was easily able to raise the temperature in my starter trays well above 80 degrees (this was with a cover on my starter trays) I actually ended up taking the cover off my starter trays because it was getting a little too hot for some of the germination temps of the seeds I was growing.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Warms Up Nicely and Fits My Jiffy 72-Slot Green House Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is my first year at seriously trying to start seeds indoors and I was a bit skeptical about this product. But the product seems to be of good quality and it warmed up quick and warmer than expected. I was concerned about it being large enough to cover the bottom of my Jiffy 72-slot green house, but it turned out to fit it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Harris Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Just what the gardener ordered
customer_reviews.text: I am starting seeds indoors for the very first time as I retired and now have the time to do so. Being a novice at all this it was helpful that this product was so easy to use. My plants are off to a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Lemire

customer_reviews.title: Great to get a good start for new seedlings
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, setup and it works great to start those early seeds in the greenhouse. This warmth is what they need to start out right and grow until the next transplant to a bigger pot and move to the outside greenhouse. Waterproof, instructions on pad so don't need any paperwork laying around and good temp overall. Have purchased 6 now in last 8 years and happy with purchase. Would recommend to other gardeners and native pollinator enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great for fermenting
customer_reviews.text: I use this mat specifically to aid in fermentation projects, mainly water kefir. This mat is large enough for two 3L fido jars, and four 500ml flip-cap bottles, with a little room to spare. I have it all just sitting out in the open on my kitchen countertop, and it does a perfect job keeping my kefir happy and warm enough to ferment. Before I had this mat, more than half my attempts would fail since I keep my house temperature pretty low (consistent 75 degrees)... but with this mat, I now have a 100% success rate!
customer_reviews.author: Config

customer_reviews.title: I put under my aerogarden, and every single one ...
customer_reviews.text: I put under my aerogarden, and every single one of my pepper seeds sprouted this year! It warms it up just enough!
customer_reviews.author: E Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat Mat!!
customer_reviews.text: This mat, together with the Hydrofarm MTPRTC Digital Thermostat, make starting seeds much more reliable. As newbies we wanted to start out right and maximize our chances of success and we are glad we choose this mat. The mat is the perfect size for our trays and does what it is supposed to do. We choose not to keep rolling the mats up after each season because of fear that the wires inside the mat might start to break over time -- but that is just our desire to do all we can to make the units last even longer. We would certainly recommend this mat!!
customer_reviews.author: George Benson

customer_reviews.title: I am using this in a heated yet still cool basement and it is doing a great job of ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in a heated yet still cool basement and it is doing a great job of keeping my flat at the proper temperature. I've been using it for just under a week and I've got lots of germinating peppers and tomatoes. This fits perfectly under a 1020 tray. I am using it with the Hydra Farm Digital Thermostat so I cannot comment on how it would work without the thermostat to regulate the temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M. Daigle

customer_reviews.title: New to growing, warm doesn't mean it works right: Manufacture defect
customer_reviews.text: New to growing watch out: Manufacture defect: Entire pad seems warm but my pad grew the seed 1.5 in around the trays edge faster every time. Tried styrofoam insulation, then tried using half the pad with same results. By the time I figured it out it was too late to turn in to Amazon, and I am looking for how to return to manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: D.H.

customer_reviews.title: BUY AMERICAN!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for the best heat mat to start spring seedlings—glad I spent some time reading reviews. Heat mats that arrived folded with air pockets prevented even distribution of heat and did not perform well. THIS heat mat arrived flat in a protective box. Heat is evenly distributed to all areas. Very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: This is great. I purchased 2 for my seedlings
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I purchased 2 for my seedlings. It helps them sprout so much faster especially when I plant them inside in the middle of winter. It's so funny to see snow on the ground outside and these seedlings sprouting thinking it's Spring. Would definitely recommend if you are growing things and need a kickstart before you plant them in your garden.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!!! This is exactly what you need for starting indoors! After using this mat my seedlings grew at least 50% more quickly in my normally cool environment of around 70 room temp. After 10 hours on the mat with a styrofoam under it to concentrate heat upwards and a jiffy seed starting try on top the mat measured 107 degrees F at its hottest part, and the soil surface in the try was 85 degrees F. This was measured with an infrared thermometer. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Staticlag

customer_reviews.title: Five star
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed. This light produces very little heat. I still need my fans but a serious reduction in heat output. Compared to HID lights. I also noticed my electric bill went down by OVER HALF. Worth every Penny.
customer_reviews.author: david l holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Not even heat
customer_reviews.text: My heat mat did not heat evenly and it showed in the sprouting of my seeds. It was like there were 2 rows about 3 inches wide that would not sprout. When I took my tray off the mat, they sprouted. When I grew another tray alongside the one on the mat, I had no problems sprouting any of those seeds, which were from the same stock. I already threw the box away, so I can't return it. I do like the grow light system from the same company, though.
customer_reviews.author: Inga Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Seed starting heat mat
customer_reviews.text: I love these heat mats. I start a large amount of seeds each year and use these to help the germination. Great tool!
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This little device worked like a charm starting my seeds last winter. I couldn't believe how much quicker it took for them to germinate when using this mat. I put it on a timer with my lights and found it easy to use and setup. It kept a nice warm temperature, never getting too hot. Hopefully it will last for quite awhile as I only get to use it a few weeks a year. UPDATE - Year 2 - Seed mat is working as designed again this year. I need to get another one as I have doubled the amount of seeds I am growing. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sikorski

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I have not had much luck starting seeds indoors even though I live in Arkansas. Just couldn't get it right until I purchased the above items. The 20" x 20" heat mat is perfect for two seed trays. It works great with the 2 foot grow light and the digital thermostat is a must to keep the temperatures where they are needed. Within days, I have more starter plants than I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: ABn_8296

customer_reviews.title: I liked it so much I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: I have been gardening for a long time. I figured I wanted to try one of these heating mats. Boy was I blown away. My tomato seeds sprouted in 2-3 days as apposed to 7-14 days. I liked it so much I bought a second one. I did buy a 4x8 sheet of construction foam, cut it down and placed it silver side up under the heating mat. This seems to work well keeping the mat from heating the table top.
customer_reviews.author: Docking Bay 94

customer_reviews.title: Improved my seed germination indoors
customer_reviews.text: This seedling mat worked as advertised. The 20x20 size fit 2 seedling trays with no room to spare. The evenness of the heat was not completely consistent and some spots were cooler than others, I rotated the trays to reduce the consequences of this. If the mat is to be used in an area with cold ambient air, the effectiveness will be limited because the mat is only able to warm the soil in the tray immediately above it. Overall, the mat worked and the germination % and time for my seeds was improved.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Ok for some things, but is not good enough for starting hot weather seedlings.
customer_reviews.text: Does not get hot enough to maintain a good temperature. I have paired this with the Hydrofarm MTPRTC Digital Thermostat and it never gets to the programmed temp. It just doesn't have enough power. I have placed styrofoam underneath, enclosed the unit, etc... I would recommend something else if you need the ability to maintain a warmer temp for hot weather seedlings.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works Well but Needs Regulator
customer_reviews.text: I am using this mat to brew kombucha and kefir water. It seems to heat very evenly. Being in norther climate this time of year ambient room temperature is not ideal for brewing (70 -80 degrees F). I do suggest using a regulator though as left unregulated it heated up my brew to almost 80 degrees. It is also important to conrol for seed sproutingas well. Hydro farms sells theirs for about $34, pretty pricey. You can use a plug in lamp dimmers such as the Lutron ones found here on Amazon for about $9. They are 300 watt rated which is way more than sufficient. Nice product but save some $$ and get your own regulator.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Clayton

customer_reviews.title: working really, really well
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these mats for seed starting season. I've had very good results with my germination rates so far. I've already started onions, leeks, broccoli (sprouted in 3 days flat!), eggplant, kale and romaine. All of these seeds have sprouted quickly and got going better than without heat. After they sprout, I move them off the mat and put them under low-hung grow lights and cycle more pots onto the mats. Working like a charm! The slowest I've seen so far are peppers and they are taking a week+ to sprout, but I know they will!
customer_reviews.author: HuskerFan

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little too warm on carpet
customer_reviews.text: I've got two of these and I really like them since it speeds up the amount of time it takes to get cuttings to root. If they were used on a cooler surface like a concrete or wood surface they'd be perfect as is but running on top of carpet they get a little too warm for my liking. I'm looking into getting some dimmers for them. I saw them on Amazon once so I just need to hunt them down so I can keep these just a little bit cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: The item delivered was not the brand that we ordered
customer_reviews.text: The product is a similar item but just not the brand that was shown. We ordered this brand after seeing it use by a reputable plant grower and then were disappointed to have gotten a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G.

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy any other brand
customer_reviews.text: Hydrofarm heat mats are the only ones that continue to work year after year. Every other brand ive bought die shortly later. You truly get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: Bcool

customer_reviews.title: Hot spots
customer_reviews.text: This mat is okay. There seems to be enough heat in the middle section, but about 2-3 inches along the edges never get even close to being warm. My seedling sprouts fried on it. On the other hand, I have my water kefir jars on it now, it being so cold. It is just enough to keep the kefir in the jars warm to keep them active without killing them. Average temp is about 74 on the hot spots. Think one might do better with a regular heating pad that is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived out of the original box, tightly rolled up in a tyvek envelope. I plugged it in, hoping the heat would help it lay flat, which it did. But I noticed it didn't really get up to the temperature I expected since many other reviews recommended buying the thermostat with it since it got pretty hot. Well, within an hr it stopped working entirely. I'm not sure to blame hydrofarm or the seller at this point considering they obviously remove it from the package in order to ship more conveniently. Either way, I can't say I'm very happy with the situation.
customer_reviews.author: Tim P. Moritz

customer_reviews.title: Not as bright as they make it out to be
customer_reviews.text: I’m only giving this light a 3 star because I’m pretty disappointed in the brightness of the light. I originally bought this to replace my 300w hydro mars grow led light and I noticed it wasn’t as bright or it is the same brightness, so I have both of my lights running. I’m thinking about returning the product and get a better one
customer_reviews.author: asdasdasd

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, go with a different light
customer_reviews.text: This isn't very bright. It's unnoticeable next to my 315w cmh. Save your money and try spectrum king, gromau5, or any OTHER reputable company. Or go with CMH (vivosun was my choice.) they're really amazing, too!
customer_reviews.author: A_Public_Profile_Name

customer_reviews.title: Gentle warming.
customer_reviews.text: I can't feel warmth from the mat, then again, it's only supposed to heat the seeds 10 - 15 degrees. The first week, I had a plastic lid over top of the flats and the heat was enough to cause condensation on the lid. Seeds did sprout so I guess it's doing it's job. I used a heating pad in the past, but it had a timed limit for how long it could be on, and I didn't want to implement a work around.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J. Wagar

customer_reviews.title: works well, decent price, small
customer_reviews.text: This product works well, and I have had no trouble with it getting warmer than I want. I didn't get a thermostat for mine, and so far I haven't felt I needed one. I am starting my seeds in school milk cartons with the tops cut off (since I am a teacher, I have access to a limitless supply), so, I think that probably helps a bit since they are a little deeper than a seed starting tray. I'd have liked to get a bigger one, but couldn't justify spending the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, very happy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product I work with a company called green jesus and these lights are very good for you or your business.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J Cole

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: I don't know anything about starting seeds, I got this because many resources online said they would help my seeds to grow. I don't know about the effectiveness of that system but this product does what it says as far as I can tell. It warms up. That's pretty much all you need to know. I did not buy a thermostat but you should be able to figure out how warm it gets by adding 10-20 degrees to your home temp.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M.

customer_reviews.title: Toasty and nice
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. good build. Does have hot spots but seems to do the job anyway. I placed a synthetic blanket under it instead of styrofoam for upwards heat radiation and it worked beautifully. Used it to root cuttings and although the cuttings failed (mulberry cuttings can be tough), the heat mat did its job by measured temps inside the potting substrate hanging at a toasty ~85F. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ArashJ

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: This heating mat gives my seedlings a great head start. My seeds sprout FAR quicker than they did before I used a heating element. In addition rare varieties of peppers and tomatoes that need to be sowed directly on the surface of the soil seem to have a higher germination rate with this heater.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: This light is great. I have it on a 6x4x4 grow tent. I have started my plants from seed. It has been doing a great job of keeping them growing. Only thing is it gets hot. I would suggest a vent fan if you are using a grow tent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anthony

product_meta.title: Seedling Heat Mat - Triple 20 x 48 from BonsaiOutlet
product_meta.description: Hydrofarm heat mats are perfect for veteran growers, beginners, and children too. They improve germination by warming the root area 10-20°F over ambient temperature. By warming the roots, you increase your growing success! Bottom heat is one of the most important and effective ways to improve germination and rooting. The seedling heat mats have been re-engineered for better performance and greater durability! The new, stronger heating wire and thicker multi-layer construction offer more uniform heating and the durability to withstand rugged greenhouse environments. Hydrofarm heat mats allow you to maintain desired fermentation temperatures in carboys and controllable heating for other hobbies, including homebrewing, Kombucha and Kefir. Measures 48x20.75 Inches
feature_bullets: Warms root area 10-20˚F over ambient temperature to improve germination to Increase success of seedlings and cuttings
Hydrofarm is the only UL-listed seedling heat mats on the market!
6 foot Power Cord and Waterproof construction
Lighting, watering, and planting information printed on mat

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars264 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
